metadata.title: CVE-2020-6581 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Nagios NRPE 3.2.1 has Insufficient Filtering because, for example,nasty_metachars interprets \n as the character \ and the character n (notas the \n newline sequence). This can cause command injection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nagios-nrpe-plugin - 4.0.0-2ubuntu1
nagios-nrpe-server - 4.0.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nagios-nrpe package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-2ubuntu1').
